Each classroom will be equipped with these cloths and non-toxic spray so that in true Montessori fashion, the students can help keep their environments clean. We're so appreciative of that, especially during these difficult times.

Many of you know that Miss Cindy, Light of the World Academy’s longtime art teacher, has opened a new art gallery right down the street from the school. It’s called Miss Cindy’s Art Learning Center & Gallery, and it’s located at 125 Pearl Street, just a half-block south of the school.

Miss Cindy is celebrating her grand opening on June 20. She’s inviting all Light of the World Academy families to attend from 2-4 p.m. She’ll have art activities for the children outside, and will allow 10 people at a time to visit inside.

At the grand opening, students will have a chance to sign up for art classes, and we’re also hoping for the students to go on field trips to the studio next year. We thank Miss Cindy for doing the Facebook Live art lessons every week during the past few months. We hope to see you all at the grand opening!

Thank you to everyone who joined us today! Here is the recipe for Anise Biscotti!

Anise Biscotti

2c All purpose flour
1/4t. Baking soda
1t. Baking powde
1/4t. Salt
2/3c. Sugar
2 ea. Eggs
1/2c. Canola oil
1T. Anise extract (can use Almond instead)

1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
2. Whip sugar and eggs until pale and thick (about 2-3 minutes)
3. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
4. Slowly add oil to egg mixture and mix till combined.
5. Slowly add dry ingredients. Mix till combined.
6. Add extract. Mix till combined
7. Scoop batter onto a floured cookie sheet and form into rectangle shape. (Use flour on your hands to prevent sticking).
8. Use white from 1 egg and brush top and sides.
9. Bake for 30 minutes at 325 degrees.
10. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
11. Slice and bake again at 325 degrees for 8 minutes per side.

We all learned that Monte and the goats are mammals, that the chickens are birds, and that Miss Kathy has fish and amphibians in her pond (and maybe reptiles).

Let me know if you make an animal classification chart - I'd love to see it! I hope you have fun learning about all the animals in our world. And I'll see you tomorrow with another Facebook Live video!

P.S. If anybody plays Pooh Sticks, remember to send me a video or picture.

Love, Miss Kathy
